intro: Werneria decumbens, commonly known as the creeping werneria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a low-growing herb with prostrate stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks.
